newsitem.title: UK: Airtours shares up on bid speculation.
newsitem.headline: Airtours shares up on bid speculation.

text.p: Shares in Airtours Plc edged higher on Tuesday amid speculation that US tour operator Carnival Corp was about to increase its stake in the company, analysts said.
Airtours shares were 11p firmer at 978-1/2p at 1004 GMT.
Carnival acquired a 29.6 percent stake in Airtours on February 22 last year, and promised at the time not to purchase any more stock in the firm for twelve months.
Merrill Lynch analyst Wayne Sanderson said he did not expect a bid announcement from Carnival in the near term but said he did think that the firm would one day wholly own Airtours.

Airtours and Carnival are close to finalising a bid for tour operator Costa Cruises, he said, with each company acquiring a 50 percent holding. "So why go to those lengths with the Costa deal if Carnival was about to bid for Airtours?"

Underlying trading in Airtours was going well, and holiday bookings were progressing well, Sanderson said, adding that windfall payments from building society privatisations could be spent on holidays.
He said these were more likely reasons for the stock's appreciation.
